main_definition: Tuition refers to the fee charged by educational institutions for instruction, guidance, or training provided to students.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The cost paid for teaching services at a school, college, or other institution of learning
meanings_and_examples.example: When I enrolled in the university, my tuition was $10,000 per semester.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Payment made by students to instructors during an informal lesson or workshop outside a formal educational institution
meanings_and_examples.example: I paid $50 in tuition for the private piano lessons I took with my teacher last month.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The process of learning something new, typically referring to academic subjects.
meanings_and_examples.example: My goal is to improve my understanding and mastery of physics, which requires a lot of tuition time.
